definition: to defeat/to damage/to lose (to an opponent)/to fail/to wither
weaponry/to hold (a weapon)/to wield/to rely on/to depend on/war/battle

sentences.english: After many defeats , the war ended for us in ultimate victory.
sentences.chinese: 吃了许多败仗后，最终还是我们打赢了战争。

sentences.english: Such one kind of mode of operations, how can not be defeated in battle?
sentences.chinese: 这样一种作战方式，怎能不打败仗？

sentences.english: The government recalled the general after he lost the battle.
sentences.chinese: 政府召回了打败仗的将军。

sentences.english: In comparison, the Persian army had just suffered from a previous defeat and some inner conflicts and divisions.
sentences.chinese: 相比之下，刚吃过一场败仗的波斯军队却内讧连连。

sentences.english: They failed, so they show the white flag to their enemy.
sentences.chinese: 该习语源出打败仗的部队向敌军举起白旗，表示投降。

sentences.english: Waterloo has since come to mean a disastrous defeat of any nature.
sentences.chinese: 从此，滑铁卢成为所有损失惨重的败仗的代名词。

sentences.english: The fight is not a losing one on God's side.
sentences.chinese: 站在神这一边的人不会打败仗。

sentences.english: On every battle field the enemy met with defeat.
sentences.chinese: 敌军在各个战场上都吃了败仗。

sentences.english: To some extent it is my fault that we lost the battle.
sentences.chinese: 在某种程度上，我们打败仗是我的过错。

sentences.english: The dog had been fighting and had obviously got the worst of it.
sentences.chinese: 那条狗打过架而且显然吃了败仗。

sentences.english: The war was lost through bad organization.
sentences.chinese: 打败仗是由于组织不当。

sentences.english: That's the only explanation for why you people have never won a fight out here.
sentences.chinese: 这是唯一可以解释为什么你们来到这里就会打败仗。

sentences.english: The company commander rallied his defeated and dispersed troops.
sentences.chinese: 连长把他的打了败仗的溃散部队重新召集起来。

sentences.english: We were defeated this time because our weapons are outdated.
sentences.chinese: 落后了，我们这次吃败仗了。

sentences.english: It was enemy's boast that they could never be defeated.
sentences.chinese: 敌人说他们永不打败仗，这是自吹之辞。

definition: to lose a war/fig. the loser (in a competition or election)
to be utterly defeated/to be routed
to defeat/to inflict a defeat on sb
weaponry/to hold (a weapon)/to wield/to rely on/to depend on/war/battle
(literary) to be routed (in a war)/to suffer defeat (in sports etc)
fighting and winning a series of battles (idiom); ever victorious
lit. strong soldiers and sturdy horses (idiom)/fig. a well-trained and powerful army
to defeat/to damage/to lose (to an opponent)/to fail/to wither
